text: This iconic bread is soft, fragrant, and beautifully shaped — often adorned with dried fruits or sugar. Handmade using traditional techniques, it’s a symbol of local pride and a must-try for every visitor.
Tiny freshwater fish from nearby lakes, fried until crispy and served with lime and spicy salsa. A bold, crunchy snack that captures the essence of regional flavor.
Sweet corn tamales made from fresh maize, steamed in husks and served with cream or cheese. Their delicate texture and subtle sweetness make them a beloved comfort food across the Bajío.
